byyKlXv_sILkhfSZLR6xeQ.text: My husband and I went to Park for the first time a few days ago with our two young daughters, and we were all happily surprised. It is rare that we can find a restaurant that fills all of our requirements, as my husband is vegan and the kids and I are vegetarian (not to mention the fact that our kids are picky eaters!). However, it was a home run for all of us! The kids loved the truffle fries and the truffle macaroni and cheese, as well as the juice; I enjoyed the fantastic caprese salad, and my husband enjoyed a grilled vegetable sandwich. The location is great, the wine and beer prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was very pleasant. We will definitely be back again, though we live rather far away near Bedok Reservoir. I wish they would open another location close to us! However, in the meantime, we will keep making the trip over as the food and atmosphere are worth it.

S7cKIkvz3qWDA5wryOVxcg.text: Friendly  service. Cute place overlooking  small park with  resident grumpy cat that's  good for people  watching. Espresso  based drinks are satisfying  with an Aussie selection.  Flat white costs  a fiver  though. Flat white and  capp will set you back  11. More Perth than Melbourne  prices.

a70K8TVAFGi3E07V0W8i5g.text: Yummy duck salad with quiona! Loved everything about it. Anqi's duck confit was really tasty too!

photos.caption: Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. Smoked duck salad with quiona

l8AfcMfQGQg1NRuGd4ATRg.text: Came here about 6pm on Friday- we were addressed as we walked up and told that they didn't currently have any available seating despite the fact that I could openly see three empty tables. Sure- maybe they were reserved... but we weren't even asked for a name. Honestly felt like we weren't "good enough" or something for them. Disgusted at the lack of service. Will not be back.

Xi6E6ZAM7L9pN1R62knctQ.text: Consistently good coffee and good food can be found here at Park. Truffle Mac and cheese is quite good, complex cheese flavor and strong dose of truffle oil. The food in general is not too exciting in terms of concept, but what they have are well executed and delicious through Park's own interpretations. Portions are always substantial and good value for money.  My own and family favourites are the spam chips and truffle fries for sharing, omega 3 salad for some greens, the burgers- Thai chicken, vegetarian and Park burger (with the blue cheese is good!), Mac and cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. All day breakfast!
Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. Yummy latte
Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. Seafood salad (not available now)

de5wF4W6zyZE0136_RbUIQ.text: (P)ark is a brand new pub-bistro setup on the site of the old Holland Village carpark.  You will recognize the huge old rain tree that was in front of Starbucks.  It's still there.  It's just a part of a big grassy park now, called Holland Village Park, sited over where the carpark used to to be.  In this small park, sits (P)ark.It's a pleasant enough place and easy enough to find in Holland Village to be an awesome meeting place to hang out before heading out for dinner or more serious drinks.Holland Village has become a very neat hub for dining, spa/beauty and pubs.  Conveniently accessible via the Circle Line (Holland Village) and surrounded by bus stops.(P)ark is all steel and glass and as I alluded to in my tip, a pretty jewel box when lit up at night.  Other than the location, it holds it's own by being quite serviceable with nice outdoor seating (covered) and a reasonable drinks menu, although truth be told there are a dozen other watering holes in Holland V to choose from which have menus just as and in most cases more extensive than (P)ark's.Worth a stop by in you're in Holland V to catch the vibe of the place, and a good vibe it is too.  I love you, Holland V!  You rock!

lxNV9D_twIzAbxlek8f1Jw.text: Had the Park Blue Cheese burger,  Stout Pork Ribs and Omega 3 Salad with the missus. Everything was excellent. The salad was especially yummy. The burger was as good as the omakase burger I had the previous week.. Except I couldn't finish the buns on this one. Ribs were very nicely marinated (in Guinness Stout no less!) and came in a very generous portion. We could barely finish everything and had a tub of fries left over. Worth a second visit to try their other items..

photos.caption: Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. Omega 3 salad with salmon, smoked salmon, salmon skin, roe...
Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. Stout pork ribs
Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. Park Blue Cheese Burger

B6ND4Zj_4ql_rsdYo_W2iw.text: PARK is a nice little new gastropub in HV.  They have a pretty straight forward menu that serves up good and interesting food.  The atmosphere is nice and relaxed. The food was well made and good.  I thought it was very good actually considering it was such a casual atmosphere.  I had a seafood salad.  The dressing was a little bland but its more a matter of personal choice. I also had a chicken breast with pureed spinach that was pretty tasty.  I like that the chicken wasnt over cooked and dry.  They have a great menu and I definitely have to go back for the truffle mac and cheese.  The service was great and the staff were really friendly.  Definitely much better food than most the bars in HV.  I think its my new go to spot in HV for drinks and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. Mexican chicken breast with pureed spinach
Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. Lava cake

eMj7djIAhJEMjYkPHaMgcg.text: This is the only place I've seen where you can get a few pitchers of beer served in a giant table-top Eiffel Tower. The beer itself was very light and almost sweet, as if it had a hint of champagne in it. The location was very crowded, which made it difficult to get a seat. Most of our group had to stand on the outside edge of the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Park - Singapore, Singapore. tower

G-Ay299L6pCk9CeLn-TbpA.text: Only dined here once. Food was surprisingly good and i loved the Eiffel Tower-:)
